column4: you can build your own java .deb which you then install... people will tell you the better way is to obtain existing debs at some place like where the bot will tell you, but that has legal problems that can get you AND the place where you got it in trouble.

I've been using Slackware for years, because for a long time it was the _only_ distro where _everything_ worked out of the box (no flame intended). Now I gave Kubuntu 5.04 a try, and I was so impressed that I decided to migrate all my four boxes to it.
glad it worked out
now you suggest I build my own java .deb? from sources? with checkinstall?
no, use java-package
can you be a bit more explicit please? (remember I only need it for firefox)
sure I will :) AFTER you install java-package, read man make-jpkg and read /usr/share/doc/java-package/SUPPORTED
thanks very much... as a slack veteran I'm not a lamer for rtfm:oD
with kubuntu i feel like driving a honda goldwing after years of enfield bullet:oD
I'm not sure you'd lack for any understanding after that, but in case you do, people here do know how to use it
who are they? is this the developer channel mainly?
read the docs... there's a misconception you have that will be dispelled
anyway... i especially like the no-bullshit side of it. I installed my main server with ubuntu server, got it up and running in no time. nice.
well... it's a hell of a lot of a difference to irc.debian.org#debian... ever tried to grasp some info there?
I'm a dd :P
I'm here trying to determine why a ubuntu hoary install succeeded where a debian sarge install failed (related to dhcp)
last time I gave debian a try was when I tried Potato's desktop potential a few years ago. Boy, what a mess...
but before reinstalling my server I hesitated briefly between Debian Sarge and Ubuntu.
I think (stupidly) that what made me decide for Ubuntu was the rude tone on irc.debian.org:oD
maybe "Debian" is the kwazooli word for "shitty attitude towards the rest of humanity" LOL
some people there do have stinky attitudes, asuffield, mwilson, one or two others, me at times
you're ON irc.debian.org NOW :)
this is irc.freenode.net
